decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. Atraxa, Grand Unifier serves as the commander, providing access to all four colors and enabling a variety of powerful spells to be included in the deck. The deck includes a mix of efficient counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Will, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Fatal Push, and card advantage engines like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect your own threats, and ultimately outvalue them through card advantage. This deck aims to control the game and dictate the pace of play to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by manipulating the graveyard and opponent's resources while also utilizing the powerful abilities of Aminatou, the Fateshifter. The deck includes a variety of cards for disruption, card advantage, and reanimation, allowing the player to outvalue their opponent over time. By utilizing cards like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Corpse Dance, along with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, the deck aims to dominate the board and sculpt the game to its advantage. With access to efficient control spells like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Daze, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions through powerful creatures and game-ending spells like Balance and Show and Tell.

This deck revolves around using Vohar, Vodalian Desecrator as the commander to create a fast and aggressive playstyle focused on reanimating powerful creatures and disrupting opponents. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Corpse Dance to bring back creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty for a quick and impactful presence on the battlefield. The deck also includes a variety of disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Duress to control the game and protect its own game plan. With a mix of card draw, graveyard recursion, and aggressive threats, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and decisively in Duel Commander 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on utilizing the partner commanders Thrasios, Triton Hero and Tymna the Weaver to generate card advantage and mana ramp, while also including a wide range of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to pressure the opponent and control the board. The deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence through creatures like Elves and powerful threats like Baleful Strix and Barrowgoyf, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares. The deck is designed to be flexible and adaptable, able to switch between aggressive and controlling strategies based on the matchup, ultimately aiming to outvalue and overrun the opponent in the mid to late game.

This deck focuses on utilizing Azusa's ability to play additional lands from the hand each turn, ramping up quickly to generate a strong mana base. The deck includes a variety of land-based control elements such as Maze of Ith, Dust Bowl, and Tectonic Edge to disrupt opponents' strategies. It also features cards like Ramunap Excavator and Crucible of Worlds to ensure consistent land drops and repeated land destruction. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats like Primeval Titan, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Emrakul, the Promised End. It also includes cards like Finale of Devastation and Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for key creatures and close out the game.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures and powerful spells to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. By using the partner commanders Thrasios, Triton Hero and Tymna the Weaver, the deck combines the card advantage from Tymna's ability with the mana ramp from Thrasios. With a mix of mana dorks, tutors, and removal spells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own board presence. The inclusion of versatile cards like Birthing Pod, Survival of the Fittest, and Finale of Devastation allows for a toolbox approach, adapting to different situations as needed. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining tempo, applying pressure, and outvaluing the opponent.

The focus of this deck is on utilizing a combination of creatures, spells, and graveyard recursion to create powerful synergies and combos that can overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards that can generate additional mana, tutor for key pieces, and reanimate creatures from the graveyard. The commander, Old Rutstein, provides additional graveyard interaction and can be a key piece in certain combos. The goal is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to execute a game-winning combo or overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence. The deck is designed to be proactive and efficient, allowing the player to dictate the pace of the game and secure a fast victory.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells, utilizing Marath, Will of the Wild as the commander. The deck focuses on building a strong board presence early on, ramping up mana quickly with mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Elves, and using cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling to find key creatures. Interaction is crucial, with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats. The deck also features powerful combo pieces like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Felidar Guardian for explosive finishes. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game swiftly.

The deck revolves around aggressive play with Fury','','');">Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury as the commander. It aims to quickly establish board presence and deal damage efficiently to the opponent. The deck includes a mix of creatures, removal spells, and card draw to maintain tempo and pressure. Additionally, it incorporates cards like Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon to disrupt opponent's mana base. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and access to different colors of mana. Overall, the key strategy is to apply early pressure, control the board, and finish off the opponent swiftly before they can stabilize.

The deck revolves around utilizing Aminatou's abilities to manipulate topdecks, blink creatures for value, and control the board with removal spells and counters. It focuses on using cards like Agent of Treachery and Animate Dead to steal and recur powerful creatures from opponents, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by constantly drawing cards, returning threats from the graveyard, and controlling the board with a mix of removal and counterspells. It has a strong control game plan with the ability to grind out victories through card advantage and powerful reanimation effects.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to apply pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Satya, Aetherflux Genius acts as the commander, providing card advantage and additional spells to cast. The deck includes a combination of cheap creatures like Elite Spellbinder and Mantis Rider, along with powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt to control the board. It also includes counterspells such as Force of Will and Mana Leak to protect its own threats. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent color access for casting spells efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on casting a wide range of multicolored cards to take advantage of Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to draw cards and gain card advantage. By including a variety of powerful spells and creatures of different colors, the deck aims to control the game by disrupting opponents' plays while building up its own resources. With a mix of removal, card draw, and powerful threats, the deck can adapt to different situations and outvalue opponents in the long run. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards with multiple color identities to maximize Niv-Mizzet Reborn's potential and ensure a diverse and flexible game plan.
